anika._.vashisth: We don't get to choose the shade of our skin, not even the way our lips curl or arms fold, we don't get to choose the structure of our bones and the weird metabolism, nor the perfect places to have moles, we don't get to chose our insecurities, our flaws. They are there, along with all the other things we like about ourselves, the flaws, the constant nagging in the brain about how part of my stomach is supposed to have this % of fat and how my thighs are not allowed to kiss each other. The persistent annoying skin lightening cream or fat burning scheme just light up our insecurities, things we are always trying to cloak behind some invisible veil. But that what makes us, us. All those imperfections, moles, darkspots, hair at wrong places, this makes us 'us'. What we do get to chose is how we love those folds, those tiny black territories, our dark side, we do get to chose the way we deal with 'parlour wali Aunty's neverending criticism', we do get to chose the love we want for us, and if we are not able to love our flaws, why are we seeking the same from others. Self love begins, it's a struggle, it's a war we have wuth ourselves and one we have to conquer. @redheadwayfarer ,your words always gave me power to look beyond my petty nose or pesky eyebrows.
